verses.text: O give thanks unto the \sc Lord\sc*; for \add he is\add* good: Because his mercy \add endureth\add* for ever.
Let Israel now say, That his mercy \add endureth\add* for ever.
Let the house of Aaron now say, That his mercy \add endureth\add* for ever.
Let them now that fear the \sc Lord\sc* say, That his mercy \add endureth\add* for ever.
I called upon the \sc Lord\sc* in distress: The \sc Lord\sc* answered me, \add and set me\add* in a large place.
The \sc Lord\sc* \add is\add* on my side; I will not fear: What can man do unto me?
The \sc Lord\sc* taketh my part with them that help me: Therefore shall I see \add my desire\add* upon them that hate me.
\add It is\add* better to trust in the \sc Lord\sc* Than to put confidence in man.
\add It is\add* better to trust in the \sc Lord\sc* Than to put confidence in princes.
All nations compassed me about: But in the name of the \sc Lord\sc* will I destroy them.
They compassed me about; yea, they compassed me about: But in the name of the \sc Lord\sc* I will destroy them.
They compassed me about like bees; They are quenched as the fire of thorns: For in the name of the \sc Lord\sc* I will destroy them.
Thou hast thrust sore at me that \add I\add* might fall: But the \sc Lord\sc* helped me.
The \sc Lord\sc* \add is\add* my strength and song, And is become my salvation.
The voice of rejoicing and salvation \add is\add* in the tabernacles of the righteous: The right hand of the \sc Lord\sc* doeth valiantly.
The right hand of the \sc Lord\sc* is exalted: The right hand of the \sc Lord\sc* doeth valiantly.
I shall not die, but live, And declare the works of the \sc Lord\sc*.
The \sc Lord\sc* hath chastened me sore: But he hath not given me over unto death.
Open to me the gates of righteousness: I will go into them, \add and\add* I will praise the \sc Lord\sc*:
This gate of the \sc Lord\sc*, Into which the righteous shall enter.
I will praise thee: for thou hast heard me, And art become my salvation.
The stone \add which\add* the builders refused Is become the head \add stone\add* of the corner.
This is the \sc Lordâ€™s\sc* doing; It is marvellous in our eyes.
This \add is\add* the day \add which\add* the \sc Lord\sc* hath made; We will rejoice and be glad in it.
Save now, I beseech thee, O \sc Lord\sc*: O \sc Lord\sc*, I beseech thee, send now prosperity.
Blessed \add be\add* he that cometh in the name of the \sc Lord\sc*: We have blessed you out of the house of the \sc Lord\sc*.
God \add is\add* the \sc Lord\sc*, which hath shewed us light: Bind the sacrifice with cords, \add Even\add* unto the horns of the altar.
Thou \add art\add* my God, and I will praise thee: \add Thou art\add* my God, I will exalt thee.
O give thanks unto the \sc Lord\sc*; for \add he is\add* good: For his mercy \add endureth\add* for ever.
